txt.en:
'I wonder if you have the temerity to provoke the captain of these wild men? Perhaps, perhaps not.

'Prove it to me. Take this ox-skull, upon which I have engraved insulting signs, and place it before the tent of the Uch-l√ªth's captain. If he has any sense of honour, he will come forth and do battle with you.

'If you defeat him, perhaps the Ox-clan will return to their homes peaceably.'
'Ha! I wish I could have seen the wild man's face!\n\n'At least it shows that some Dunlendings do have a sense of honour which can be insulted.'
'Show these Ox-clan merchants what I think of them....'
A company of Ox-clan warriors are encamped on the western edge of the Gravenwood, arrayed for war.
Placed the ox-skull before the tent of the Ox-clan's captain
Place the desecrated ox-skull before the tent of the Ox-clan's captain

The Ox-clan captain's tent may be found within Rhuvel-cadlus, in the valley below Cuthric's post.\n\nCuthric wants you to place a desecrated ox-skull before the tent of the Ox-clan's captain in an effort to goad him into single combat.
Cuthric is hiding on the ridge above Rhuvel-cadlus.\n\nYou should return to Cuthric and tell him that you have done as he asked.
